bibl.title: Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiuro v. United States. Motion for Re-Trial.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seatle

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States, for the Western District of Washington Northern Division
In the matter of the Petition of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiura, alias B.K. Sugiura, aliens, for Writ of Habeas Corpus } #2628 Motion for a New Trial

Come now the petitioners, Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiura, alias B.K. Sugiura, aliens, and move the Court for an order granting a re-trial and rehearing in the above entitled proceedings, upon the following grounds to-wit:
(1) Insufficency of the evidence to justify the decision, and that there is no evidence in the record justifying and authorizing the deportation of petitioners.

(2) Error of law occuring at the trial, in this, to-wit: Error of the Court in construing that portion of Section 3 of the Immigration Act of 1907, as amended by the Act of March 26, 1910, which reads: "Any alien +++ who in any way assists, protects, or promises to protect from arrest any prostitute."
div1.ab: R. W. McClellan H. A. P. Mayers Walter L. Johnstone Attorneys for Petitioners.
div1.p: United States of America State of Washington County of King. } ss

H. A. P. Myers being first duly sworn on oath deposes and says: that he is one of the attorneys for the above named petitioners; that he has read the above and foregoing motion for a new trial, and believes the same to be meritorious and well-founded in law.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24th day of Feburary, A.D. 1914
D.A. Keenan Notary Public residing at Seattle, Washington
In the District Court of the United States For the Western District of Washington Northern Division
In the matter of the Petition of Albert H. Young et al, for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division Feb 24 1914 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk. By EML Deputy.
R.W. McClellan, H.A.P. Myers Walter L. Johnstone
Attorney for Petitioners Empire Building Seattle, Wasbington
Service of within Notice and receipt of copy admitted this 24th day of Feb 1914 G.P. Fishbourne Attorney for Respondent.
